cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses the use of sequence-to-sequence models for sentence simplification, which is a natural language processing task. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of reinforcement learning and memory augmentation, which are techniques commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of a leveled word complexity model, which could fall under the sub-category of natural language processing or neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper discusses the use of a novel sentence complexity model, which could fall under the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
